name: The Hammurabi Project
tagline: Codifying U.S. law in machine-executable form
body:
The Hammurabi Project is an experiment in codifying U.S. law - such as the U.S. Code, the Code of Federal Regulations, state laws, etc. - as executable computer code. 

The project's basic components are:

1. A core library of C# classes and functions that facilitate the representation of legal knowledge.
1. Legal rule files written in a domain specific language called Akkadian (.akk).
1. A primitive compiler that converts the Akkadian files into C#.
1. Unit tests for the core library and the legal rules. 

More information can be found on the [project wiki](https://github.com/mpoulshock/hammurabi/wiki).
